title: Knowl Hill Bridleway Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: don cload / Knowl Hill Bridleway Circuit
images.caption: Knowl Hill Bridleway Circuit. This path is part of the Knowl Hill Bridleway Circuit. Notice the well made old boundary banks on either side of the track.

images.title: Rosalind Mitchell / Knowl Hill
images.caption: Knowl Hill. The Seven Stars was once an important staging post on the Bath Road. Then the A4 was rebuilt around the village, and then came the M4. The old road is on the right, the A4 can be seen in the distance.

images.title: don cload / Ways to go on Bowsey Hill
images.caption: Ways to go on Bowsey Hill. Signpost for the bridleway which can also be used by horses.

images.title: Andrew Smith / Pasture and woodland edge, Knowl Hill
images.caption: Pasture and woodland edge, Knowl Hill. The southern edge of Ashley Hill Forest viewed from the public footpath that forms the direct route between Knowl Hill and the top of Ashley Hill.

images.title: Andrew Smith / Grassland and woodland above Wargrave
images.caption: Grassland and woodland above Wargrave. A small uncultivated field stands beside Bottom Boles Wood on the shallow western slopes of Bowsey Hill.

images.title: Andrew Smith / Coronation Road, Littlewick Green
images.caption: Coronation Road, Littlewick Green

images.title: Bikeboy / The Bell pub, Waltham St Lawrence
images.caption: The Bell pub, Waltham St Lawrence

description: This shared cycling and walking route follows the Knowl Hill Bridleway around Wargrave and Twyford. The looped trail explores the woodland, hills, countryside and villages surrounding Knowl Hill. The route starts and finishes at Twyford just to the north of the train station. On the way you'll pass the villages of Burchett's Green, Littlewick Green and Waltham St Lawrence. There's some lovely views over the area from the high points on the circuit. The eastern side of the route passes close to Maidenhead Thicket which is well worth a small detour if you have time.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: The Bell in the pretty village of Waltham St Lawrence is a fine choice for a pit stop. The historic pub dates back to the 15th century and has a wonderful old interior with log fires and classic features. Outside there's a sunny garden to relax in on warmer days. You can find them at postcode RG10 0JJ for your sat navs.

display_address: Tesco Express, 25, London Road, Twyford, Wokingham, England, RG10 9EH, United Kingdom
